src: Haroun and S.A. Mourad, Proceedings of International Colloquium on Structural Engineering, Cairo, Egypt, April 1992, pp.
mt: Haroun and S.A. Mourad, Proceedings of International Colloquium on Structure Engineering, Cairo, Egypt, April 1992, pp.
gpt_explanation: The only inaccuracy is the term “Structure Engineering” instead of the correct “Structural Engineering,” a minor terminology error that doesn’t obscure the meaning but deviates from standard nomenclature, warranting a quality score of 1.

src: Faerie Apocalypse, Jason Franks, IFWG Publishing Australia.
mt: Faerie Apocalypse, Jason Franks, IFWG Publishing Australia.
gpt_explanation: The translation is identical to the source, preserving the title, author name, and publisher name exactly with no omissions or alterations, demonstrating full accuracy and fluency.

src: Center for Advanced Study in the Behavioral Sciences fellows
mt: Center for Advanced Study in the Behavioral Sciences Fellows
gpt_explanation: 2 The translation perfectly mirrors the source text, maintaining all key terms and proper capitalization to accurately render the formal title “Center for Advanced Study in the Behavioral Sciences Fellows” without omissions or distortions.

src: Grushenka inspires complete admiration and lust in both Fyodor and Dmitri Karamazov.
mt: Grushenka begeistert sowohl bei Fjodor als auch Dmitri Karamazow völlige Bewunderung und Lust.
gpt_explanation: Die Übersetzung trifft Sinn und Wortwahl weitgehend, doch das fehlende zweite „bei“ in der Konstruktion „sowohl bei Fjodor als auch bei Dmitri Karamazow“ sowie die etwas unidiomatische Verwendung von „begeistert bei“ statt etwa „löst … aus“ sind Kleinigkeiten, die den Lesefluss minimal stören, aber die Aussage nicht beeinträchtigen.

src: Real Time Relativity The Australian National University.
mt: Real Time Relativity Die Australian National University.
gpt_explanation: The translation incorrectly replaces the English article “The” with the German article “Die” while leaving the rest of the title in English, creating a mixed‐language, ungrammatical phrase that obscures the original meaning and constitutes a major error.

src: Apostasy Brights movement Death of God theology Dysteleology Lists of atheists Outline of atheism
mt: Apostasie Brights Bewegung Tod Gottes Theologie Dysteleologie Listen von Atheisten Darstellung des Atheismus
gpt_explanation: The translation is largely comprehensible and correctly translates each term, but it contains minor word‐order and style issues: “Brights Bewegung” should be “Brights-Bewegung,” “Tod Gottes Theologie” is an awkward literalism instead of “Gottes-Tod-Theologie” or “Theologie vom Tod Gottes,” and “Darstellung des Atheismus” doesn’t accurately render “Outline of atheism,” which would be better as “Gliederung des Atheismus” or “Überblick über den Atheismus.” These are minor deviations that don’t impede understanding but prevent a fully natural German rendition.

src: Retrieved December 27, 2014.</ref><ref>[[Loïc Wacquant]].
mt: 27. Dezember 2014. < / ref > < ref > [[Loïc Wacquant]]
gpt_explanation: The date itself is correctly formatted for German, but the key term “Retrieved” is omitted (no “Abgerufen am”), and the ref tags are malformed with extraneous spaces (“< / ref >” instead of “</ref>”), indicating minor errors that don’t block understanding but break accuracy and syntax.

src: The common Jacobite supporters fared better than the ranking individuals.
mt: Den gemeinsamen Jakobiten ging es besser als den Ranking-Individuen.
gpt_explanation: The translation uses “gemeinsamen” incorrectly for “common” (it means “shared”), and “Ranking-Individuen” is a calque that German speakers wouldn’t use—instead of “gewöhnliche Jakobitenanhänger” versus “ranghohe Personen.” These literal, non-idiomatic renderings constitute major errors that impede a natural, fluent reading.

src: The common Jacobite supporters fared better than the ranking individuals.
mt: Den gemeinsamen Jakobiten ging es besser als den Ranking-Individuen.
gpt_explanation: Die Wahl von „gemeinsam“ für „common“ ist irreführend, da es im Deutschen „zusammen“ bedeutet statt „gewöhnlich“, und „Ranking-Individuen“ als wörtlicher Anglizismus ist unidiomatisch und unklar, hier wären etwa „gewöhnliche Jakobiten“ und „ranghohe Personen“ angemessener; dadurch entstehen gravierende Lexikalisierungsfehler, die den Satz zwar verständlich, aber semantisch ungenau und stilistisch holprig machen.

src: While reminiscing, she interchanges places with her young self.
mt: Während sie erinnert, tauscht sie Orte mit ihrem jungen Selbst aus.
gpt_explanation: Die Formulierung „Während sie erinnert“ ist unidiomatisch – besser wäre etwa „Während sie in Erinnerungen schwelgt“ oder „Beim Erinnern“. Auch „tauscht sie Orte mit ihrem jungen Selbst aus“ klingt holprig und zu wörtlich; idiomatischer wäre „tauscht mit ihrem jüngeren Ich die Plätze“. Die semantische Aussage bleibt zwar nachvollziehbar, doch die unnatürlichen Wendungen und die falsche Wortstellung stören den Lesefluss und die Genauigkeit.

src: A powerful warrior and armoursmith, Iorek repairs the Subtle Knife when it shatters.
mt: Als mächtiger Krieger und Panzerschmied repariert Iorek das Subtile Messer, wenn es zerschmettert.
gpt_explanation: The translation preserves the original syntax and meaning with correct verb placement and case usage, but the choice of “Panzerschmied” for “armoursmith” is non-idiomatic (a more usual term would be “Rüstungsschmied”), making this a minor lexical slip that doesn’t impede understanding.

src: During the recording of Audioslave's last album, Revelations, Morello experimented with different amplifier setups.
mt: 在录制最后一张音像专辑《启示》时, 莫雷洛尝试了不同的放大器插座.
gpt_explanation: The translation omits “Audioslave,” mistranslates “album” as “音像专辑” rather than “专辑” or “录音室专辑,” and renders “amplifier setups” as “放大器插座” (“socket”) instead of “放大器设置,” causing major meaning shifts though the gist remains.

src: Description: This is a stone sculpture showing the human head with a protuberance on the top.
mt: वर्णन: मानवी डोक्याला वरच्या बाजूला उगवणारी ही दगडी मूर्ती आहे.
gpt_explanation: The translation conveys the main idea—a stone sculpture of a human head with something protruding atop—but uses उगवणारी (“sprouting”) to render “protuberance,” which is a mismatched verb form that makes the phrase awkward; aside from this minor lexical mismatch the Marathi is grammatical and the intended meaning remains clear.

src: Creeds and Confessions of Faith in the Christian Tradition.
mt: Glaubensbekenntnisse in der christlichen Tradition.
gpt_explanation: Score: 1. Die Übersetzung ist flüssig und korrekt, doch „Glaubensbekenntnisse“ deckt nur „creeds“ ab und lässt den eigenständigen Terminus „confessions of faith“ vermissen, wodurch die Zweigliedrigkeit des Originals nicht vollständig übertragen wird.

src: Res judicata (RJ) or res iudicata, also known as claim preclusion, is the Latin term for "a matter decided" and refers to either of two concepts in both civil law and common law legal systems: a case in which there has been a final judgment and is no longer subject to appeal; and the legal doctrine meant to bar (or preclude) relitigation of a claim between the same parties.
mt: रेस ज्यूडिकेटा (Res judicata (RJ) या रेस ज्यूडिकेटा (res iudicata), जिसे क्लेम प्रीक्लूजन (claim preclusion) के रूप में भी जाना जाता है, एक मामले के लिए लैटिन शब्द है और सिविल कानून और कॉमन लॉ लीगल सिस्टम दोनों में दो अवधारणाओं में से किसी एक को संदर्भित करता हैः एक मामला जिसमें एक अंतिम निर्णय हो चुका है और अब अपील के अधीन नहीं है और कानूनी सिद्धांत का उद्देश्य एक ही पक्षों के बीच दावे के निवारण को रोकना (या रोकना) है।
gpt_explanation: The translation generally conveys the meaning but repeats “रेस ज्यूडिकेटा” twice, mistranslates “a matter decided” as “एक मामले के लिए लैटिन शब्द” instead of “निर्णीत विषय,” renders “relitigation” awkwardly as “दावे के निवारण को रोकना (या रोकना),” and leaves English terms in parentheses without Hindi equivalents; these minor inaccuracies and stylistic lapses slightly disrupt readability but do not obscure the overall sense, warranting a score of 1.

src: Procedure of Appellate Tribunal.
mt: અપીલીય ટ્રિબ્યુનલની પ્રક્રિયા.
gpt_explanation: Merits a score of 2 as it accurately and fluently renders “Procedure of Appellate Tribunal” into Gujarati legal terminology—“અપીલીય ટ્રિબ્યુનલની પ્રક્રિયા”—using the correct genitive marker without omission or distortion.

src: But the Disney villains turned Scott into a monkey much to his disappointment.
mt: Aber die Disney Bösewichte verwandelten Scott in einen Affen zu seiner Enttäuschung.
gpt_explanation: The translation accurately conveys that the Disney villains turned Scott into a monkey, but the phrase “zu seiner Enttäuschung” sounds unnatural in German—one would rather say “was Scott sehr enttäuschte” or “zu seinem großen Bedauern”—so it’s understandable yet stylistically awkward, hence a minor error and a score of 1.

src: Three Tampa Bay quarterbacks completed a combined 3 of 8 passes for −4 yards.
mt: Drei Tampa Bay Quartiere absolvierten zusammen 3 von 8 Pässen für − 4 Yards.
gpt_explanation: The translation fails to render the crucial term “quarterback” correctly (Quartiere means lodgings), uses an unnatural verb choice (“absolvierten” is too formal and odd here), and awkwardly spaces the minus sign, resulting in a rendition that is inaccurate and stilted, obscuring the meaning of the original.

src: The two streams are separate until they come together by appointment.
mt: இந்த இரண்டு நீரோடைகளும் சந்திக்கும் வரை தனித்தனியாக இருக்கும்.
gpt_explanation: The Tamil rendition fluently conveys that the two streams remain separate until they meet, but it omits the specific nuance of “by appointment,” thereby losing the sense of a scheduled or prearranged convergence—a minor omission that doesn’t block understanding but does detract from full accuracy.

src: Bring Weighing Boat 1 to flask 1.
mt: फ्लास्क 1 के लिए वजन वाली नाव 1 लाएं।
gpt_explanation: This translation merits a score of 1 due to minor word‐choice and postposition errors that don’t impede understanding: “वजन वाली नाव” is an unnatural rendering of “weighing boat” (a more accurate term would be “तौलने की नाव” or simply “वजन नाव”), and “के लिए” wrongly expresses purpose instead of direction toward flask 1 (it should use “को…तक” or “पर” to convey movement to flask 1).
